page.title: 14Family Life in Halewood.
page.content: Each member of a class of eight year olds at the Church of England School wre given a questionnaire to find out about family life. Our families have lived in our present homes on average between six and eleven years. Most families are settled in this area and have no plans to leave Halewood. Asked why Halewood was chosen as a place to live, three main reasons were given: Nearness to grandparents or work and the newness of the housing estates. About half the childrens' families have relatives also living in Halewood. Most fathers are employed and a small number of mothers have jobs. Although Ford's is a major industry in Halewood few of our fathers worked there. Most of the fathers were professional or skilled manual workers whose jobs were outside Halewood.
